## Tidy data is data where:

.pull-left[

- #### Every column is variable.
- #### Every row is an observation.
- #### Every cell is a single value.
]

.pull-right[

![](img/tidydata_happy.jpeg)
]

---
## Installing the `tidyr` package
```{r eval=FALSE}
# The easiest way to get tidyr is to install the whole tidyverse:
install.packages("tidyverse")

# Alternatively, install just tidyr:
install.packages("tidyr")

# Or the development version from GitHub:
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("tidyverse/tidyr")
```
## Load tidyr library
```{r eval=FALSE}
library(tidyr)
```

---
## Pivotting 
 - converts between long and wide forms using `pivot_longer()` and `pivot_wider()`

.pull-left[
```{r eval=FALSE}
pivot_longer(
  data,
  cols,
  names_to = "name",
  names_prefix = NULL,
  names_sep = NULL,
  names_pattern = NULL,
  names_ptypes = NULL,
  names_transform = NULL,
  names_repair = "check_unique",
  values_to = "value",
  values_drop_na = FALSE,
  values_ptypes = NULL,
  values_transform = NULL,
  ...
)
```

]

.pull-right[
```{r eval=FALSE}
pivot_wider(
  data,
  id_cols = NULL,
  id_expand = FALSE,
  names_from = name,
  names_prefix = "",
  names_sep = "_",
  names_glue = NULL,
  names_sort = FALSE,
  names_vary = "fastest",
  names_expand = FALSE,
  names_repair = "check_unique",
  values_from = value,
  values_fill = NULL,
  values_fn = NULL,
  unused_fn = NULL,
  ...
)
```

]

## Splitting and combining character columns. 
Use separate() and extract() to pull a single character column into multiple columns; use unite() to combine multiple columns into a single character column.

```{r eval=FALSE}
separate(
  data,
  col,
  into,
  sep = "[^[:alnum:]]+",
  remove = TRUE,
  convert = FALSE,
  extra = "warn",
  fill = "warn",
  ...
)
```

## Subset columns using their names and types - select()

--
### Selection features 
- :, !, & and |, c() 

--

### Helpers functions
- everything(), last_col(), starts_with(), ends_with(), contains(), matches(), all_of(), any_of(), where()

--
```{r eval=FALSE}

select(.data, ...)
```


---
## Code Walthrough


---




## Create, modify, and delete columns - mutate()

```{r eval=FALSE}
mutate(.data, ...)

# S3 method for data.frame
mutate(
  .data,
  ...,
  .keep = c("all", "used", "unused", "none"),
  .before = NULL,
  .after = NULL
)

transmute(.data, ...)
```


---
## Code Walthrough


---

## Subset rows using column values - filter()

```{r eval=FALSE}
filter(.data, ..., .preserve = FALSE)
```

--

### Useful filter functions

These includes:
==, >, >= etc

&, |, ! 

is.na(), between(), near()

## Code Walkthrough



---

## Summarise each group to fewer rows - summarise(), summarize()

```{r eval=FALSE}
summarise(.data, ..., .groups = NULL)

summarize(.data, ..., .groups = NULL)
```

--
## Arrange rows by column values - arrange()

```{r eval=FALSE}
arrange(.data, ..., .by_group = FALSE)
```
